location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Charles Umpherston Aitchison, Foreign Department, Government of India, Simla to Colonel Lewis Pelly

mods.abstract: Letter, dated 7 July 1873 enclosing a note from Colonel William Earle regarding Major Charles George Gunning's appointment and advising Pelly to have instructions waiting at Kheewarra [Khairwāra] for the officer that eventually goes there.Enclosed note from William Earle to Charles Umpherston Aitchison, 7 July 1873, regarding Earle having written to Sir Frederick Haines about the state of the Meywar [Mewār] Corps asking him to hand his letter to Major Gunning as well as asking that Aitchison inform Pelly to have instructions ready at Kheewarra.A note from Pelly at the end of the letter, dated 22 July 1873, records that a copy of the correspondence has been sent to Colonel Hutchinson,
